references.paper_title: Generating Diverse and Natural 3D Human Motions from Text
references.reason: This paper introduces a method for text-conditioned motion generation, which is the foundation for the current work's approach to generating human motion from text descriptions.
This paper introduces the Motion Diffusion Model (MDM), which is the core component of the current work's motion generation framework.
This paper introduces the fundamental concept of denoising diffusion models, which is crucial for understanding and adapting diffusion-based motion generation approaches.

references.paper_title: Structure and content-guided video synthesis with diffusion models
references.reason: This paper shows how diffusion models can be used for video generation, providing insights into the current work's approach to generate multi-person motion sequences.
This paper introduces classifier-free guidance, which is adapted for precise control of human joints in the current work.
